Reviews.Title: “Good price”
Reviews.Author: Ragweedchic
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed a night here because it was close to Beef & Boards Dinner Theater. We got the king suite for under $100 so it was worth it. It's a basic hotel but it is clean. The bed was comfortable and we liked that we could control the temperature in the room. Even though it is winter it was warm and we were able to turn the air on to cool it down.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good! Brian at front desk is AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: Mark B
Reviews.Content: This place is very good overall. Brian at the front desk is fantastic!! He always said, "Hello" and "goodbye" to EVERYONE making you feel very welcome. We stayed for two weeks (broken up) while I was transitioning locations for my job. The housekeeping staff is very nice as well. They do a good job of keeping the room clean. The morning breakfast is good if you get there early, otherwise all the good stuff is gone... QUICK! ;) The only minus that makes me a little hesitant on the "Excellent" status was the internet. The internet is satellite internet and is really slow and sluggish 95% of the time. It is not fast at all. Still, I would stay here again in a heartbeat and deal with the internet just from all the people being so nice!!!

Reviews.Title: “V noisy plumbing”
Reviews.Author: Tina H
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the Superbowl, the hotel is a simple drive from the airport, approx 30 mins. It is a bashoy towel type, I'm sure reasonable in price when not Superbowl weekend, but $250 a night it definately wasnt worth. The breakfast is a bonus and was quiet good. The only thing is the plumbing is so loud that at 3am when next door decided to have a shower, it sounded like a aeroplane was trying to land in my room!

Reviews.Title: “Don't be tricked !”
Reviews.Author: HOTELQUEENBEE9
Reviews.Content: Some of the rooms may be furnished better , but not ours! They have this DVD at the front desk showing pics of the rooms. Looks can be deceiving. There was a 1990's hot tub in the room that had red stains on the washcloth. Pulled down the bed sheets, blacks hairs everywhere. Called front desk for new sheets an blanket. We had to make our own bed in front of the desk person because they physically could not do it. The window was broken and the locks were busted. It was letting in a draft. We only came there because a Marriott gave away our room and there were no other rooms in the city. Funny thing, comfort inn charged the Marriott 150.00 for our stay!

Reviews.Title: “For the $50-60 prices I see listed, acceptable. Maybe. Maybe not.”
Reviews.Author: Luvamoose67
Reviews.Content: We stayed recently at the Comfort Inn and Suites North for a convention. Our rate was a total with tax of $102/night due to the convention. It appears they are usually $50-60/night.) Our gorgeous new Holiday Inn Express rooms traveling to Indy were $115/night. The hotel itself gives the appearance of being quite old-- 1960's maybe? Carpets in our rooms are fairly worn and the rooms in general are simply dingy. The grounds are clean as is the hotel itself. Upon entering our room from a fresh smelling hallway, the smell of smoke was evident. My floor was not a smoking floor. It got worse and we told the front desk about it. Despite the best of intentions, it absolutely was NOT addressed the next day as we were told it had been. Three of the rooms in our group did not have the beds made either. There was not a single item left on the bed in two of the rooms, one had a trundle bed in the way apparently, but all three rooms were noted as having the rooms completely done on the cleaning sheets that the front desk gets. Unnecessary. The towels were replaced and the garbage emptied in all. Day two our beds were made and the smoke smell virtually gone, but it did return as the week went on. The Internet was nearly impossible to connect to, even when most rooms were empty in mid-day. It also dropped easily. The rooms did have a microwave, small fridge, ironing board and iron. The power strip didn't seem the safest and was under the bed, and they lacked plugs anywhere near the computer desk for a laptop. While I may be swayed by the high price we paid for this hotel, I have balanced it out by leaving an "average" rating rather than "poor". The people working here both last year and this were all very kind and helpful (except when the cleaning was inadequate). The breakfast is good, quite standard now, but they kept up well with so many guests. The fact that smoking is still allowed in hotels is amazing to me. Having the first floor as a smoking floor only lets the smell rise. Walking through the first floor to use the stairs is like being in the bowels of hell. I feel horrible for the cleaning people who must be in that atmosphere. Truly, this hotel would not be on any list of hotels I'd recommend. I hesitate to stay in a place with such a low normal rate as it isn't ever what we want. But the people who work there are the only reason I would say give it a chance. They are very welcoming and try hard to help you enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Trip to Indy with FFA”
Reviews.Author: 1964Denise
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a student convention with my son and other parents and students. While the breakfast area and other public areas where kept clean and tidy that was not always tur in other areas. Upon arrival our room smelled of smoke (a non-smoking room), when mentioned to the clerk at the desk he stated it would be cleaned the next day. When we came back to our rooms the next day around 6 pm, our room still smelled of smoke and and our beds were not made. I checked with others in there group and out of 4 rooms only one room had there beds made. The internet was difficult to get onto and there were not enough plugs in the room. With the number of hotels in the area I would be hard pressed to stay at this location again.

Reviews.Title: “Still Great”
Reviews.Author: Roundabout41348
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed here several times since my first review of the place over a year ago. Each time has been a great experience. This time was no different. The room was very clean, the bed was clean and comfortable, the furniture was all in good repair. The wireless internet was easy to connect to. The computer desk had plenty of room for all my gadgets. The bathroom was very clean. The bathroom counter has lots of room. I love the massaging shower head and the great pressure. We've stayed in a lot of hotels and this is one of our top favorites. This time we got up early enough for breakfast and it was also very good. The breakfast room has plenty of tables and space for guests, along with a flat screen TV so you can watch the news while you eat. The lobby is also very nice, with a fireplace and bookshelves. You can even borrow a book if you want.

Reviews.Title: “WE won't be back!”
Reviews.Author: pmann40208
Reviews.Content: Booked a suite "with a courtyard view" for our Vice President and Proj. Coordinator - Hotel personnel put them in a smoking room when we clearly asked for a Non-Smoking room and the rooms were smaller than Motel 8! When you say a suite with a courtyard view maybe print a picture of exactly what the view is - it certainly was not the courtyard - there was nothing attractive about this hotel - We have been Choice Privilege members for several years and this is the worse ever - we will definitely consider some other program if this is the kind of treatment our upper management receives. Thank goodness this room was free because of our points, otherwise I would ask for our money back. As it stands we just wasted our privilege points. How disappointing!

Reviews.Title: “Good value; I'd stay again”
Reviews.Author: theduelingprincess
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and quiet. Air conditioning worked fine. Not the finest of rooms, but for the price paid, I felt it was good value. Front desk service was excellent; very friendly and helpful. The hair dryer in our room wasn't working and the staff quickly replaced it. Breakfast was excellent, with make-your-own-waffles, scrambled eggs, and sausage patties. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great response”
Reviews.Author: blue08usa
Reviews.Content: I think the rooms are very clean. But the one thing that stands out the most is the Management. Jeff and Jason...Had a problem and within mins they solved it by moving me into another room. Super job, well done, .......Eugene

Reviews.Title: “Dated but comfy”
Reviews.Author: sij003
Reviews.Content: Very friendly front desk. This is a very comfortable hotel -- it definitely needs updating but it is kept up pretty well. We had a king suite which is two separate rooms but only the bedroom was air-conditioned which might be an issue in really hot weather. It is definitely 1980's in decor -- having wallpaper on the walls, but comfortable and clean -- sorta like visiitng your older aunt's house. The bathroom had a very low vanity which was odd. I loved that it had two recliners in the bedroom in a sitting room arrangement. Bed was very comfortable -- the droan of the air-conditioner was like 'white noise.' Ruby Tuesday's was right next door -- great dinner and salad bar for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough”
Reviews.Author: kimmer26
Reviews.Content: Booked this at the last minute on line on the way home from a FL vacation because it was near a Cracker Barrel. Became a little difficult to find because of road construction and the fact there was more than 1 Cracker Barrel. Once there, the room was a nice Comfort Inn room (did not have a suite). Fridge/micro, good pressure on shower. Free internet, hot breakfast w/waffles,oatmeal, cereal, toast, juices, coffee, etc. but no eggs or sausage. Large area to eat. Quiet. Restaurants within walking distance. Safe area on motel/food row. Free parking.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Comfortable and Quiet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: countryd00d
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with my stay at the Comfort Inn & Suites. The room was very well decorated, clean, and quiet!! The front desk staff was very courteous and helpful. I stayed here three nights on my winter vacation to Indy. I picked this hotel primarily because of the affordability of the room, and with my prior stays at Choice Hotel properties throughout the east coast and mid-west. The hotel was in an excellent location, next to restaurants, shopping centers, the interstate, etc. The room had a microwave, refrigerator, coffee maker, iron and ironing board. The best was extremely comfortable, and had a lot of pillows. I will definitely stay here again on my next visit to Indianapolis!!

Reviews.Title: “Safe location, good breakfast, wish they had queen sized beds”
Reviews.Author: PaulInMichigan
Reviews.Content: No problems at all except the bed size. We were traveling with teenagers and had to double up on beds. The king beds with the rollaway didn't sound very appealing, so we took the two doubles. Other than that, the place was a very good example of what a Comfort Inn establishment could be. Breakfast was as expected. It was a pleasant surprise to find out that they had enough dining area to handle their breakfast crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutly Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: MommaTeri
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Indy Nov. 8th for a doctor's appointment. We book a room at this hotel and I must say I was very pleased. The price was awesome, the staff was awesome, the hotel and our room were very nice and clean and the breakfast was super :) Will absolutly stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “It was nice”
Reviews.Author: outtheseams
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a busy location with many places to shop and dine. The room was clean but air condtitioning unit was loud. Breakfast was good. Pool was clean and inviting. Only one computer was available for guests to use.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Henry24
Reviews.Content: This was a very clean and comfortable place. The breakfast was great and the staff was fantastic. We had the room and Children's Museum package and this was a great deal! Beds were comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Decent room for price”
Reviews.Author: Schneider231
Reviews.Content: Our room was as advertised, hotel was fairly quiet, easily accessible, plenty of stores and restaraunts nearby. We stayed while taking my son to Butler University. Breakfast room was nice, windows faced the outside pool. Breakfast selections were meager. Only had Apple Juice no orange juice, small fresh fruit selection. Our room was a worn (shelf in bathroom was wobbly) and smelled of chlorine. Able to open patio doors to air out room, was decent for price. Did not have fitness center on site, had arrangements with local gym.

Reviews.Title: “great price good hotel”
Reviews.Author: captaincarroll
Reviews.Content: I come to this area often abd have stayed in some of the hotels on this strip some considerably more expensive. The service and accomodations were comperable to some of the other more expensive hotels. breakfast is decent room was damp though.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful group of people”
Reviews.Author: dlcook1971
Reviews.Content: I travel with my job every week and while in indianapolis i choose to stay at the Comfort inn North at Pyramids. The entire staff is freindly and outgoing. The make me feel like i am a home. Jason and his staff are wonderful people to stay with

Reviews.Title: “Excellence at its best!”
Reviews.Author: Jakesmom414
Reviews.Content: I was in town for surgery. We previously stayed at this hotel and was impressed enough to stay again. I had to report for surgery at 4:45am the next morning. We had a comfortable room, clean and plenty of towels, etc. The price is very reasonable. We were concerned with the price being less than $60/night that we might not end up staying once we saw the room. What a pleasant surprise. It was as nice as any Hampton we had ever stayed in and much nicer than the Crowne Plaza/Denver airport. The breakfast was plentiful, even though I could not have it, and it is the routine continental breakfast but they keep the food coming. Great location too. We'll definitely be staying here again when in Indy and highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Roundabout41348
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were looking for a nice place to stay near Indy. We found it here. The desk clerk was very nice at check-in. Our room was spacious and very clean. The bed was very clean and comfortable with extra pillows. The furniture was in good repair, the wireless internet was easy to connect to and had good speed. The computer desk had plenty of room for my gadgets. The heating unit was quiet and worked well. The bathroom had plenty of counter space. The water pressure was outstanding and the water was soft. The shower/tub had a bowed shower curtain and a massaging shower head. The shower head combined with the outstanding water pressure gave the best shower massage I've had from a hotel anywhere at any price. Wow, I would go back for this feature alone! We missed the breakfast so I can't comment on that, although the breakfast area looked very nice and laid out well. The lobby had a fireplace with a real burning fire and you can sit around and enjoy the fire. All this combined with a great price makes this one of the best deals we've found in a long time. We will be back again when the weather is a little warmer and we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay At The Comfort Inn”
Reviews.Author: Sliphorn
Reviews.Content: I stopped over at this Comfort Inn on my way to catch a train in Chicago. I was able to park near the front entrance on this cold night and registered immediately. I asked for a new internet rate I had seen and got it on request. The room was in good condition and I was able to heat it to my preferences. The room was nice for the $40 price as it had nice decor and all amenities I would want. The breakfast was fine (I made a waffle) and everyone was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Consistant”
Reviews.Author: mikeandwife91
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here the past few years on my way through Indy and I keep coming back. Nothing fancy. Good location. Safe. Clean room. Wireless works fine. Not many TV stations though.

Reviews.Title: “OK Comfort Inn for budget travelers”
Reviews.Author: jjctraveler
Reviews.Content: This is not your normal Comfort Inn. Red brick, brown steel and balconies it has a classic 70s design but it is probably just 10 years old. Checkin was quick from the friendly lady at the front desk in the very large lobby. Room 237 was nice with a Queen sized bed and large balcony facing Michigan Avenue. The bed was soft, and overall the room was worn with some peeling wallpaper and a well used chair. The bathroom is average sized with a large counter. I couldn’t get the wireless internet to work, but there was a long wire in the room which worked just fine and was very fast. Breakfast was OK, with yourself waffles you make yourself, no bread for toast, but they did have bagels. I had slight security concerns with the balconies on the second floor since people from adjacent rooms can easily cross over to your balcony. My room faced Michigan Avenue and was rather noisy. Rates here vary; I spent two nights at the nearby Super 8 because the Comfort Inn was $80, but then moved to the Comfort when rates dropped to a reasonable $50. The Indianapolis room tax of 17% is outrageous.

Reviews.Title: “Actually pretty decent for the price”
Reviews.Author: mmd2e
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night. Basically just needed a place to crash for a few hours (plane came in at midnight and had business to conduct early the next morning), and this fit the bill. Is this place "nice"? Not really, but for less than $40, I was very pleasantly surprised. The front desk attendant was very nice and helpful when I arrived, even though it was one in the morning. The building is a little dated, and could use some updates (wallpaper beginning to come up at the seams, tiles in bath could use some caulk in places (and grout on floor could use a good bleaching), TV had a definite yellow tint to the picture), but the bed was fine and the room was overall in better shape than I feared it would be. The clientele at the hotel seemed pretty normal (did not seem seedy, even though the rate was so cheap). The breakfast was pretty basic, and did not really have anything I was interested in eating, but what do you expect for $40? All in all, not a bad place if you're just looking for a cheap place to crash for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice value minded hotel”
Reviews.Author: RahRah11
Reviews.Content: Just spent saturday night at the Comfort Inn at the Pyramids and would recommend it for a budget minded traveler. Stayed in a king suite and the room was clean and the bed was comfortable. Like most hotels the foldout sofa bed was not luxiorious was but it was fine for the kids. Breakfast was a low end continental breakfast but what do you expect for a $70 hotel. If you are looking for a cheap room in Indy I would not hesitate to book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: PlainsWoman
Reviews.Content: I used the hotel's website to book my stay and paid $52.15 (incl tax) for a non-smoking room, king bed, double occupancy. I stayed 6 nights in a different motel each night across IN and OH, so on reflection, think it was an excellent value. I found the staff very welcoming, both at arrival and departure. There is a sign on the desk advertising a 7# bag of ice for $1.50 (which I used the next morning). A Ruby Tuesday's is directly across the lot; hotel staff also directed us to several close restaurants. Entire 2nd floor is non-smoking, so no cigarette odors in hallway or room. Room was middle-sized, with window overlooking the very bright parking lot (had to clothespin the drapes to make them stay closed). Bathroom had a very effective exhaust fan and good shower curtains and showerhead. Amenities and towels only so-so. High speed wi-fi was actually high speed. Very few plugs in the room, though, into which to plug the laptop or the cell phone charger. Bed had decent top to it, but was wobbly - every movement was noted by my husband and vice versa. Pillows were okay, but not great. Breakfast was coffee, juice, yogurt, cereals and assortment of breads, including bagels and cream cheese. A sign on the microwave advised that bowls of oatmeal would melt, so the oatmeal I had brought from home wasn't going to be useful here. I didn't see any problems with security at this location; we did leave a GPS mount in place on the dash and it (and the window glass) was there in the morning. All other valuables of course were inside. I did notice that the night staff was a little friendlier than the morning staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel & decent rates”
Reviews.Author: tarb68
Reviews.Content: We just stayed here two nights ago (5/29/09) and had no problems like the last reviewer regarding safety issues. The parking lot was well-lit, and I even took a walk around the office complex across the street as it was getting dark, and felt safe doing so. The outdoor pool / deck is nice, but not heated. Breakfast was just fine- standard, extended continental style. Our room was very clean and the bathroom was absolutely spotless- very important to me. Minor cosmetic details could be nicer- wallpaper loosening at one seam (not flapping, just needed seam redone) and at the top of the bathroom mirror the glaze was peeling. Otherwise, room was just what we needed- included coffeemaker, recliner & another chair. Watch for odd phone charges- I didn't use it with our long distance phone card, but the hotel phone label stated that even 800# calls would be subject to a $2.00 fee. Local calls were free up to 20 minutes, then $2.00 fee- ?? Walls are thick enough that noise is not an issue. I plan to stay here again when in Indy overnight.

Reviews.Title: “Good if you don't want your GPS or windows!!!”
Reviews.Author: AlabamaTate
Reviews.Content: While staying at this hotel recently, my car was broken into, along with several other vehicles. The driver's side window was shattered and the criminal took a GPS mount that was on my dash. My GPS was in my room, but the other guest's were taken. The front desk clerk called the cops. Upon questioning, she told me that no video surveillance or security was available outside. Also, when I asked for a vaccuum for help with removing glass from my car, she paged a man that gave me a little broom and a dustpan. At this time, it began to rain and snow. No further help was offered. When I asked for help finding a glass service, I was told there was a phone book in my room! The service and security at this hotel are way below average. If you choose to stay here, make sure you hide anything valuable or even related to a GPS. I know I wish I would have known about the "common" activity. I would have picked another town to stay in."

Reviews.Title: “Great Value--Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Preacher10
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel 4/16-4/17/09. I was plesantly surprised. This hotel sits in the middle of a lot of hotels, restaurant (cheap & expensive), close to an array of shopping areas, close to expressways, and a main strip (Michigan Rd). While they were laying carpet in the main lobby, there was hardly any inconvenience. Room was clean and not smelly, beds comfortable, bathroom was clean, parking easy, service was good, breakfast was just ok (I had a weak waffle, pastries, fruit, coffee). I paid $55.68 (includes tax) for one night--I would stay here again in a heartbeat!!!! If you want a cheap, clean place to stay for a short period of time--stay here!!!!!!! I will be a return guest.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel, great value for the price”
Reviews.Author: Melimeli60610
Reviews.Content: I was in Indianapolis for festivus weekend at my niece's, and decided to give the Comfort Inn a try, based on tripadvisor reviews and a great online rate. It was a good decision; the rooms are clean, the clientele was pretty considerate (seemed to be mostly couples and families), and the front desk staff was polite and efficient. I had a room facing the parking lot, which was a little noisy when the window was open, but with the window closed very little sound penetrated into the room. The bathroom was very clean, the amenities smelled nice without being too perfumey, and the water pressure was quite good. The coffee downstairs was decent, the free breakfast was pretty carb-heavy, but did offer fruit and yogurt so you didn't have to eat the waffles or donuts or bagels unless you wanted to. The entire second floor is for nonsmokers; if you have a very sensitive nose, you can tell that someone elsewhere in the hotel had smoked at some point in time, but the whiff I caught was so faint and momentary that it was almost instantly forgotten, and was certainly nothing that would bother even the highly allergic. I will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rate, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: jmvon
Reviews.Content: After reading previous reviews, i knew this hotel was the best choice. It was close to my destination, my friend's wedding/reception and the highway. The staff, especially the cleaning staff, went out of their way to accomodate my needs even though my time in the room wasn't long. I was provided with extra towels without asking for them and when I noticed an error on my bill at checkout, it was immediately resolved without any excuses. I forgot my directions to the church and when I asked at the front desk, she quickly printed some more from mapquest. Great customer services!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: ksgirl81
Reviews.Content: My son, mother-in-law, and I stayed 5 nights. The hotel was very reasonably priced (especially with it not being a race weekend). Overall I was impressed by the staff and their helpfulness. Additionally, I found the building to be in great shape, considering it was a little older. Our room was clean, as well as the pool area, and breakfast area were well taken care of and stocked. It's in a great part of town with lots to do. There's a Ruby Tuesday, Texas Roadhouse, Famous Dave's, Denny's, Cracker Barrel all within walking distance or so. Just east on 465 there are some shopping centers/malls (or just go east down 86th Street) or go either way on Michigan Road and you'll find a Walmart and Super Target. We were extremely glad we stayed in this area and this hotel specifically. We were able to still enjoy some of what Indianapolis offered downtown (by just going west and south on 465 to 65 south to the Children's Museum and Indianapolis Zoo). The zoo is GREAT by the way, as well as the Children's Museum. I'd fully expected that, however (with all the reviews I'd read previously).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Beds, Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: sjcruiser36
Reviews.Content: I booked the Comfort Inn @ The Pyramids in early March for a weekend trip April 26th with Expedia. I believe the hotel portion of the trip was around $65.00, which was well worth it. My flight arrived early and I called the hotel to get an ealry checkout due to so many late checkouts from a wedding and family reunion. No problem, since I had rental car (Dollar @IND, great cars price and service). I had my own navigation system with me so we found the Fashion Outlet Mall and some other shopping centers, that were great places to waste time. Upon returning to the hotel at 2:00pm, our room was ready and everything was as expected. The rooms were clean, and well kept. Furnishings were as expected, and none were broken, ripped, etc. We had a room with a balcony, that overlooked the pool and rear "courtyard", so it was great not to be facing a parking lot. Breafast in the morning was clean and well organized. The offerings were boiled eggs, bagles, muffins, waffles, fruits, cereals, juices, coffee and tea. The hotels is in the Pyramids Office Park, which was probably quite becuase of the weekend. There are plenty fast food and family restaurants (Famous Dave's BBQ, McD, Taco Bell, Denny's, Chick Fila, Wendy's, Panda Chinese and Cracker Barrel) all within a mile of the hotel. Walmart is less than 3 minute drive or ten minute walk. If you go to Fashion Mall, theres a Cheesecake Factory and P.F.Changs there.

Reviews.Title: “Ask for room in back”
Reviews.Author: Mike3412
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fine except for the noise from any people exiting and entering their cars. Not only could you hear the car doors slam, you could hear people talking very plainly. We were on the third floor maybe 50 feet from the hotel entrance. The are the hotel is in has many shopping and eating possibilities and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: JKSKFultz
Reviews.Content: Great value for the money. Stayed for a week. I used to live in Indianapolis, so I know the area well. Closed to great shopping. The room was nice although outdated. The bed okay. Shower okay. The breakfast was nothing to brag about unless you like high-carb offerings. Towels very stiff. The best things was the free Gold Gym visits (located about 1 mile away) that were offered since there is no workout facility at the Hotel. No washer and dryer for guests to use so I had to go to a laundry mat.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: StaKat
Reviews.Content: Went to Indy for the Brickyard 400. Hotel is North of track and out of the hustle & bustle of race weekend but a very quick/convenient drive to get to everything. Comfortable bed, probably the best hotel bed I've ever slept in. Free breakfast was superb with a large eating room with a nice view of pool. Rooms were plenty big; only wish the bathroom was slightly larger, but it wasn't a problem. Plenty of restaurants closeby. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: member34
Reviews.Content: A fine hotel, well-run, near 465 and 65, with lots of restaurants and some shopping nearby. Disabled-accessible rooms are on second floor, but there is an elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Great price and room.”
Reviews.Author: Happygiggles
Reviews.Content: I received a great last minute internet room rate. The front desk was very kind upon arrival. Room was better than I expected. Very clean and didn't have the usual hotel smell. Bed was very comfortable. King room included a table and recliner. Shower had an adjustable jet spray nozzle. Mildew just beginning-nothing a good scrubbing couldn't fix! Very little noise a night. I had no trouble getting to sleep. Did not get in pool it looked well kept and clean. Breakfast was the usual. Did offer a waffle maker. Overall, I thought the Comfort Inn was in a good location and service was more than expected. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Smoky, smoky, smoky”
Reviews.Author: JA78
Reviews.Content: This is fine for a Comfort Inn. Initially, we were given a king smokig room- the smoke smell was unbearable. In fact, the hallways and even the elevator reeked of cigarette smoke. The very friendly front desk staff switched us to a double, non-smoking room, which was adequate. The lamps over the dresser did not work. Everything seemed clean. Complementary breakfast included toaster waffles, bagels, juice, etc. A staff member lingered at the breakfast bar, seemingly to keep guests from running off with too much food.

HotelInfo.Name: Comfort Inn & Suites N at Pyramids
HotelInfo.Address: 9090 Wesleyan Road, Indianapolis, IN 46268
